xxl.collections
Class Heap

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.collections.AbstractQueue
        |
        +--xxl.collections.Heap
Direct Known Subclasses:
DynamicHeap
public class Heap
extends AbstractQueue

This class provides the heap datastructure. The clear, size, supportsPeek and peek operations and the constructors that create an empty heap run in constant time. The heapify operation and the constructors that initialize the heap with an array of objects run in amortized constant time, that is, adding n elements requires O(n) time.

The heap is stored in an internally used array that is never resized by methods of this class. This class provides no methods to change the maximum capacity of a heap. So remember that the internally used array must be able to contain all the elements the heap should be able to contain when creating a new heap. There are two way of ensuring the capacity of a heap when constructing it

  • Constructing an empty heap with the constructor Heap(int size) or Heap(int size, Comparator comparator). The internally used array is set to new Object[size].
  • Constructing a heap containing the elements of a specified array with one of the other constructors. The internally used array is set to the specified array. In this case the size of the specified array is to the maximal number of elements the heap is able to contain.
The order of the heap is determined by a comparator. More exactly, there can be three different cases when two elements o1 and o2 are inserted into the heap
  • comparator.compare(o1, o2) < 0 :
    • the heap returns o1 prior to returning o2.
  • comparator.compare(o1, o2) == 0 :
    • when inserting equal elements (determined by the used comparator), there is no guarantee which one will be returned first.
  • comparator.compare(o1, o2) > 0 :
    • the heap returns o2 prior to returning o1.
Usage example (1). 
     // create an array of objects to store in the heap

     Object[] array = new Object[] {
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(2),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("second")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(3),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("third")
         }
     };

     // create a comparator that compares the objects by comparing their Integers

     Comparator comparator = new Comparator() {
         public int compare(Object o1, Object o2) {
             return ((Integer)((Object[])o1)[0]).intValue()
                    -((Integer)((Object[])o2)[0]).intValue();
         }
     };

     // create a heap that is initialized with the array (the heap has maximum capacity of
     // 5 elements (array.length) and contains 5 elements) and that uses the given comparator

     Heap heap = new Heap(array, comparator);

     // print the elements of the heap

     while (heap.hasNext()) {
         Object[] o = (Object[])heap.next();
         System.out.println("Integer = "+o[0]+" & String = "+o[1]);
     }

     // close the open heap after use

     heap.close();
Usage example (2). 
     // refresh the array (it was internally used into the heap and has changed

     array = new Object[] {
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(2),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("second")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(3),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("third")
         }
     };

     // create a heap that is initialized with the first three elements of the array (the heap
     // has a maximum capacity of 5 elements (array.length) and contains 3 elements) and that
     // uses the given comparator

     heap = new Heap(array, 3, comparator);

     // print the elements of the heap

     while (heap.hasNext()) {
         Object[] o = (Object[])heap.next();
         System.out.println("Integer = "+o[0]+" & String = "+o[1]);
     }

     // close the open heap after use

     heap.close();
Usage example (3). 
     // refresh the array (it was internally used into the heap and has changed

     array = new Object[] {
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(2),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("second")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(3),
             new String("first")
         },
         new Object[] {
             new Integer(1),
             new String("third")
         }
     };

     // create an empty heap with a maximum capacity of 5 elements and that uses the given
     // comparator

     heap = new Heap(5, comparator);

     // generate an iteration over the elements of the given array

     Cursor cursor = new ArrayCursor(array);

     // insert all elements of the given iterator

     heap.insertAll(cursor);

     // print the elements of the heap

     while (heap.hasNext()) {
         Object[] o = (Object[])heap.next();
         System.out.println("Integer = "+o[0]+" & String = "+o[1]);
     }

     // close the open heap and cursor after use

     heap.close();
     cursor.close();

See Also:
ComparableComparator, Comparator, Function, Iterator, NoSuchElementException

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new Heap (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). In contradiction to the contract in Queue it may only be invoked with an array (parameter list) (for further details see Function) of object arrays. The array (parameter list) will be used to initialize the heap by calling the constructor Heap((Object[]) array[0]).
See Also:
Function

array

protected Object[] array
The array is internally used to store the elements of the heap. The size of this array defines the maximum capacity of the heap.

last

protected int last
An int field storing the index of the last element of the heap in the array.

comparator

protected Comparator comparator
The comparator to determine the order of the heap. More exactly, there can be three different cases when two elements o1 and o2 are inserted into the heap
  • comparator.compare(o1, o2) < 0 :
    • the heap returns o1 prior to returning o2.
  • comparator.compare(o1, o2) == 0 :
    • when inserting equal elements (determined by the used comparator), there is no guarantee which one will be returned first.
  • comparator.compare(o1, o2) > 0 :
    • the heap returns o2 prior to returning o1.
Constructor Detail

Heap

public Heap(Object[] array,
            int size,
            Comparator comparator)
     throws IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a heap containing the elements of the specified array that returns them according to the order induced by the specified comparator. The specified array has two different functions. First the heap depends on this array and is not able to contain more elements than the array is able to. Second it is used to initialize the heap. The field array is set to the specified array, the field last is set to the specified size - 1 and the field comparator is set to the specified comparator. After initializing the fields the heapify method is called.
Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to store the heap and initialize the internally used array.
size - the number of elements of the specified array which should be used to initialize the heap.
comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the heap.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified size argument is negative, or if it is greater than the length of the specified array.

Heap

public Heap(Object[] array,
            Comparator comparator)
Constructs a heap containing the elements of the specified array that returns them according to the order induced by the specified comparator. This constructor is equivalent to the call of Heap(array, array.length, comparator).
Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to store the heap and initialize the internally used array.
comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the heap.

Heap

public Heap(int size,
            Comparator comparator)
Constructs an empty heap with a capacity of size elements and uses the specified comparator to order elements when inserted. This constructor is equivalent to the call of Heap(new Object[size], 0, comparator).
Parameters:
size - the maximal number of elements the heap is able to contain.
comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the heap.

Heap

public Heap(Object[] array,
            int size)
Constructs a heap containing the elements of the specified array that returns them according to their natural ordering. This constructor is equivalent to the call of Heap(array, size, ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE).
Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to store the heap and initialize the internally used array.
size - the number of elements of the specified array which should be used to initialize the heap.
See Also:
ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE

Heap

public Heap(Object[] array)
Constructs a heap containing the elements of the specified array that returns them according to their natural ordering. This constructor is equivalent to the call of Heap(array, array.length, ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE).
Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to store the heap and initialize the internally used array.
See Also:
ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE

Heap

public Heap(int size)
Constructs an empty heap with an initial capacity of size elements and uses the natural ordering of the elements to order them when they are inserted. This constructor is equivalent to the call of Heap(new Object[size], 0, ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE).
Parameters:
size - the maximal number of elements the heap is able to contain.
comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the heap.
See Also:

Method Detail

heapify

protected void heapify()
Computes the heap for the first (last + 1) elements of the internally used array in O(n) time.

bubbleUp

protected void bubbleUp(Object object,
                        int i)
Inserts the specified object into the heap and overwrites the element at the index i of the internally used array without damaging the structure of the heap. The specified object is inserted into the path from the root of the heap to the element with the index i and the whole path beyond the inserted element is shifted one level down. This method only works fine when the following prerequisites are valid
  • 0 <= i <= last
  • comparator.compare(array[0], object) <= 0
Parameters:
object - the object to insert into the heap.
i - an index of the internally used array. The specified object is inserted into the path from the root of the heap to the element with the index i.

sinkIn

protected int sinkIn(int i)
Removes the element at the index i/2 of the internally used array without damaging the structure of the heap. The whole path from the element at the index i of the internally used array to the bottom level of the heap is shifted one level up. This method only works fine when the following prerequisite is valid
  • 1 <= i <= last
Parameters:
i - an index of the internally used array. The object at the index i/2 of the internally used array is removed.
Returns:
the index of the last element in the path that is shifted one level up.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all of the elements from this heap. The heap will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
Overrides:
clear in class AbstractQueue

size

public int size()
Returns the number of elements in this heap. If this heap contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE elements, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
Overrides:
size in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
the number of elements in this queue.

insert

public void insert(Object object)
Inserts the specified element into this heap and restores the structure of the heap if necessary.
Overrides:
insert in class AbstractQueue
Parameters:
object - element to be inserted into this heap.

insertAll

public void insertAll(Iterator objects)
Inserts all of the elements in the specified iterator into this heap and restores the structure of the heap if necessary. The behavior of this operation is unspecified if the specified iterator is modified while the operation is in progress.
Overrides:
insertAll in class AbstractQueue
Parameters:
objects - iterator whose elements are to be inserted into this heap.

peek

public Object peek()
            throws NoSuchElementException,
                   UnsupportedOperationException
Returns the next element in the heap without removing it. The next element of the heap is determined by the comparator.
Overrides:
peek in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
the next element in the heap.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - heap has no more elements.
UnsupportedOperationException - if the peek operation is not supported by this heap.

next

public Object next()
            throws NoSuchElementException
Returns the next element in the heap. The next element of the heap is determined by the comparator.
Overrides:
next in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
the next element in the heap.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - heap has no more elements.

replace

public Object replace(Object object)
               throws NoSuchElementException
Replaces the next element in the heap with the specified object and restore the structure of the heap if necessary. More exactly, the specified object is inserted into the heap and the next element of the heap is overwritten. Thereafter the structure of the heap is restored and the overwritten element is returned. This method only works fine when the following prerequisite is valid
  • comparator.compare(array[0], object) <= 0
Overrides:
replace in class AbstractQueue
Parameters:
object - element to be inserted into this heap.
Returns:
the next element in the heap.

supportsPeek

public boolean supportsPeek()
Returns true if the peek operation is supported by this heap. (In other words, returns true if peek would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)
Overrides:
supportsPeek in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
true if the peek operation is supported by this heap.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a Heap. It can also be used to test the functionality of a Heap.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
